text: Neuchâtel District is one of the six districts of the canton of Neuchâtel, Switzerland. The district capital is the town of Neuchâtel. It has a population of (as of ). == Municipalities == The district has nine municipalities: Coat of Arms Municipality Population () Area km²Swiss Federal Statistical Office-Land Use Statistics 2009 data accessed 25 March 2010 Cornaux 4.72 Cressier 8.55 Enges 9.59 Hauterive 2.12 La Tène 5.44 Le Landeron 10.31 Lignières 12.51 Neuchâtel 18.1 Saint-Blaise 8.87 Total 80.21 == Mergers == * On 1 January 1966 the municipality of Landeron-Combes changed its name to Le Landeron.Nomenklaturen – Amtliches Gemeindeverzeichnis der Schweiz accessed 4 April 2011 * On 1 January 2009, Marin-Epagnier and Thielle- Wavre merged to form the new municipality of La Tène. == References ==
title: Neuchâtel District
